isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - DESCRIPTION - INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHTS

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water
svcsubproc.para: The "OIL/WATER" warning light and red lens provide a warning, to driver of the vehicle, that the engine's oil pressure is running low, that its coolant temperature is running high, or the coolant level is low (with electronic engines). Thus the driver can take the necessary actions to protect the engine. This light is also used with International engines to signal that the engine is going to shut down in 30 seconds due to either idle shutdown counter or engine protection system.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure
svcsubproc.para: The "BRAKE PRESS" warning light and red lens provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that one of the following conditions is present: the air pressure has dropped below an acceptable level to keep the brakes fully released with an air brake system, or that there is an abnormal condition detected by the hydraulic brake monitor module.

svcsubproc.title: Coolant Level
svcsubproc.para: The "COOLANT LEVEL" warning light and red lens were used with mechanical engines to provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that the level of the engine coolant is down to a minimum level for safe operation. With electronic engines, the coolant level is monitored by the engine ECM. The red Oil/Water warning lamp is used to warn of a low coolant condition.

svcsubproc.title: Change Oil
svcsubproc.para: The "CHANGE OIL" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that it is time to get the vehicle in for an oil change. This feature, available on vehicles with the International consolidated engine controller (CEC), keeps track of mileage and engine hours by using a programmed service interval counter to determine that it is time to change the engine oil and turn on the warning light.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Engine
svcsubproc.para: The "STOP ENGINE" warning light and red lens, used with non-International engines, provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that the engine is going to shut down in 30 seconds due to either the idle shutdown timer or engine protection circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Warn Engine
svcsubproc.para: The "WARN ENGINE" warning light and yellow lens provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that a sensor or system of the engine is not performing as it should. This condition could be affecting performance and or emissions, and indicates that the driver should get the vehicle into a shop for servicing. This light is also used in conjunction with the (STI) Self Test Initialization switch and "STOP ENGINE" light to display active and inactive engine fault codes.

svcsubproc.title: Traction Control
svcsubproc.para: The "TRAC CNTL" warning light and green lens provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that the optional traction control circuitry has been engaged, and that the antilock braking has been switched off.

svcsubproc.title: Check Transmission
svcsubproc.para: The "CHECK TRANS" warning light and yellow lens provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that the transmission is overheating (with Allison non-electronic transmissions), or that the transmission is overheating, or the ECU senses a problem (with Allison WTEC III electronic transmissions).

svcsubproc.title: Left Turn Indicator
svcsubproc.para: The left turn arrow indicator light and green lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the turn signal switch is in the left turn position by blinking in unison with the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock Brake Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The "ABS" indicator light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the antilock brake system is activating and overriding the engine retarder. The light will also illuminate when a fault in the ABS system is detected by the ABS controller.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder On
svcsubproc.para: The "RETARD ON" indicator light and green lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the transmission retarder has been enabled. Thus the driver will be reminded to turn off the retarder when road surfaces are slippery.

svcsubproc.title: Change Transmission Filter
svcsubproc.para: The "CHANGE TRANS FILTER" warning light and yellow lens provide a warning, to the driver of the vehicle, that the transmission fluid filter has become restricted.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder Overheat
svcsubproc.para: The "RETARD OVER HEAT" warning light and red lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the transmission retarder has reached an unsafe operating temperature. At this point the driver should switch off the retarder and allow it to cool before turning it back on.

svcsubproc.title: Alternator
svcsubproc.para: An "ALTERNATOR" warning light location and yellow lens is provided for possible later use.

svcsubproc.title: High Beam Indicator
svcsubproc.para: The high beam indicator light and blue lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the headlights are on and switched to the bright position.

svcsubproc.title: Right Turn Indicator
svcsubproc.para: The right turn arrow indicator light and green lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the turn signal switch is in the right turn position by blinking in unison with the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Water-In-Fuel
svcsubproc.para: The "WATER-IN-FUEL" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that there is water up to the probe in the fuel filter. Thus the driver knows that the filter must be drained or changed to prevent water from getting into the engine.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Filter
svcsubproc.para: The "FUEL FILTER" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the fuel filter is becoming excessively plugged or restricted. Thus the filter should be changed to prevent hard starting, power limiting, or stalling.

svcsubproc.title: Power Take Off (PTO)
svcsubproc.para: A location for a body-builder to install a "PTO" warning light is supplied in the instrument cluster, and a red lens is also provided.

svcsubproc.title: Low Brake Fluid
svcsubproc.para: A "LOW BRAKE FLUID" warning light and red lens is used in the 3000FE and 3000RE model to warn the driver of the vehicle that the brake master cylinder is low on fluid.

svcsubproc.title: Wait-To-Start
svcsubproc.para: The "WAIT-TO-START" warning light and yellow lens signals the driver to hold off on cranking over the engine until the glow plugs have heated up.

svcsubproc.title: ((P)) Low Air
svcsubproc.para: The "((P))"ark brake "LOW AIR" warning light and red lens warns the driver that the air park brake system has either not yet pumped up to a pressure that will reliably release the park brake, or that the system is losing pressure and the park brake is going to apply. The light is used only with SE code orders.

svcsubproc.title: PDL
svcsubproc.para: The power divider lock "PDL" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the power divider lock is engaged. Thus the driver can remember to unlock the power divider when acceptable road surfaces are reached.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Brake
svcsubproc.para: The "PARK BRAKE" warning light and red lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the parking brake is applied. This light is utilized with both air and hydraulic brake systems.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Brake
svcsubproc.para: The "PARK BRAKE" warning light and red lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the parking brake is applied. This light is utilized with both air and hydraulic brake systems.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Washer Fluid
svcsubproc.para: The "WSHLD WASH FLUID" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the windshield washer reservoir tank is low on windshield washer fluid.

svcsubproc.title: Front Axle
svcsubproc.para: The "FRONT AXLE" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the transfer case has shifted to transfer power to the front drive shaft and axle, thus indicating that the vehicle is in four wheel drive.

svcsubproc.title: Diff Lock Engaged
svcsubproc.para: The "DIFF LOCK ENGAGED" warning light and yellow lens provide an indication, to the driver of the vehicle, that the differential lock is engaged. Thus the driver can remember to unlock the differential when acceptable road surfaces are reached.

svcsubproc.title: Suspension Low Air
svcsubproc.para: The "SUSP LOW AIR" warning light and red lens warn the driver that the air suspension system has not yet pumped up to a safe level for operation, or that a leak has developed in the system and that it is deflating.
